meanings.sent1: She piked across the playground to catch up with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah piked through the grasslands in pursuit of its prey.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel piked up the tree to escape the barking dog.
meanings.sent4: Time piked forward as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The river piked downstream with great force.

meanings.definition: Having a pointed or sharp tip
meanings.sent1: The piked fence kept the rabbits out of the garden.
meanings.sent2: The knight's helmet had a piked design on top.
meanings.sent3: The piked mountain peak looked majestic against the sunset.
meanings.sent4: The piked icicles hung dangerously from the roof.
meanings.sent5: The piked arrowhead gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: He piked from the party without saying goodbye.
meanings.sent2: The cat piked out of the room when it heard the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent3: The magician piked from the stage, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The car piked away in a cloud of dust.
meanings.sent5: The bird piked off the branch and flew into the sky.
